Act4Scene1.speaker: Second Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Something wicked this way comes. Open, locks, Whoever knocks.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: How now, you secret, black, and midnight hags? What is ’t you do?

Act4Scene1.speaker: All
Act4Scene1.text: A deed without a name.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: I conjure you by that which you profess (Howe’er you come to know it), answer me.

Act4Scene1.speaker: First Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Speak.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Second Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Demand.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Third Witch
Act4Scene1.text: We’ll answer.

Act4Scene1.speaker: First Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Say if th’ hadst rather hear it from our mouths Or from our masters’.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Call ’em. Let me see ’em.

Act4Scene1.speaker: All
Act4Scene1.text: Come high or low; Thyself and office deftly show.

Act4Scene1.speaker: First Apparition
Act4Scene1.text: Macbeth! Macbeth! Macbeth! Beware Macduff! Beware the Thane of Fife! Dismiss me. Enough.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Whate’er thou art, for thy good caution, thanks. Thou hast harped my fear aright.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Second Apparition
Act4Scene1.text: Macbeth! Macbeth! Macbeth!—

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Had I three ears, I’d hear thee.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Second Apparition
Act4Scene1.text: Laugh to scorn the power of man, for none of woman born shall harm Macbeth.
Act4Scene1.translation: Mock the power of man, for none born from a woman will harm Macbeth

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Then live, Macduff; what need I fear of thee? But yet I’ll make assurance double sure And take a bond of fate.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Thou shalt not live, That I may tell pale-hearted fear it lies, And sleep in spite of thunder.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Third Apparition
Act4Scene1.text: Macbeth shall never vanquished be until Great Birnam Wood to high Dunsinane Hill Shall come against him.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Sweet bodements, good! Rebellious dead, rise never till the Wood Of Birnam rise, and our high-placed Macbeth Shall live the lease of nature, pay his breath To time and mortal custom. Why sinks that cauldron? And what noise is this?

Act4Scene1.speaker: First Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Show.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Second Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Show.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Third Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Show.

Act4Scene1.speaker: All
Act4Scene1.text: Show his eyes and grieve his heart. Come like shadows; so depart.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Horrible sight! Now I see ’tis true, For the blood-boltered Banquo smiles upon me And points at them for his. What, is this so?

Act4Scene1.speaker: First Witch
Act4Scene1.text: Ay, sir, all this is so. Come, sisters, cheer we up his sprites And show the best of our delights. That this great king may kindly say Our duties did his welcome pay.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Where are they? Gone? Come in, without there.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Lennox
Act4Scene1.text: What’s your Grace’s will?

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Saw you the Weïrd Sisters?

Act4Scene1.speaker: Lennox
Act4Scene1.text: No, my lord.

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: The castle of Macduff I will surprise, seize upon Fife, give to th’ edge o’ th’ sword his wife, his babes, and all unfortunate souls That trace him in his line.
Act4Scene1.translation: I'll launch a surprise attack on Macduff's castle, kill his wife, children, and anyone related to him

Act4Scene1.speaker: Macbeth
Act4Scene1.text: Where are these gentlemen? Come bring me where they are.
